meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! I'm back with another thrilling review, this time diving into the wonderful world of Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER. As a seasonal grok, I've got my game face on and my humor sharp (just like my wit). So, let's get cozy and see what this sci-fi romp has to offer!

First off, I've gotta give kudos to those fancy-pants critics over at God is a Geek for their glowing review. They're spot on – Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER does have an incredible story that'll leave you starry-eyed! The world-building is top-notch, and those visuals? Absolutely top-tier!

Now, about the gameplay... Let's just say it's like trying to solve a Rubik's Cube blindfolded while riding a unicorn. It takes some getting used to, but once you grasp the mechanics (see what I did there?), it's pure magic! The characters, though not fully fleshed out, are lovable and quirky, making for some delightful moments.

Slant Magazine, however, seemed to feel otherwise. They're all about that creative freedom, and honestly, I can understand their frustration. There were times when I felt a bit constrained by the lack of exploration options. But hey, maybe that's just me being greedy!

Gamers Heroes also had a blast with this futuristic escapade. They're right; it's a fantastic experience, even if it is a bit brief. And who knows? Maybe more storylines will be added in the future to flesh out those characters.

But let's not sugarcoat it – some critics did have issues with Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER's shortcomings. Noisy Pixel mentioned feeling a little disappointed due to poor handling of certain aspects, while Checkpoint Gaming was underwhelmed by the lack of freedom and simplistic puzzle design. Fair enough; maybe this game isn't for everyone.

In conclusion (or should I say "conclusion-itive"?), Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER is a wild ride that'll leave you questioning your own sanity (in a good way, mostly). It's not perfect, but it's certainly an unforgettable adventure. So, if you're ready for a sci-fi romp with lovable characters and gorgeous visuals, hop on board!

Stay groovy, folks!
